It's quite brilliant and will be a first port of call when we go back to Madrid.  Loved it.

review_preview: I visited this restaurant on my first night in Madrid as it was close to my hotel and the reviews were so good. I enjoyed it so much that I went back again on my last night. The two nights were are a completely different...
review_full: I visited this restaurant on my first night in Madrid as it was close to my hotel and the reviews were so good. I enjoyed it so much that I went back again on my last night. The two nights were are a completely different experience so if I go back to Madrid again I'll know how how to do it right. The first time I went, we got seats at the bar and we were in the center of all the action, orders coming in, new people arriving and we had some interaction with the barman. We ordered 4 dishes, all good, they came one at a time so we had some time to chat and take in the atmosphere in between. There was a bit of a delay before the final dish arrived, we didn't mind but our host insisted on giving us some free wine to make up for it. The second night we got a table and again ordered 4 dishes, but this time they all arrived together. The food was still excellent but the night seemed to pass by so much quicker... so next time I'll be looking for a bar stool. The dishes that I enjoyed most turned out to be the ones marked on the menu with a star (recommended dishes)

title_review: Fantastic food, service and atmosphere - don't miss it!
review_preview: I've visited El Sur a few times due to a friend who lives in the same street and it is just a really great value place with fantastic food. I have tried the salmon salad, moussaka, tortilla espanola (incredible), the chicken curry and most of...
review_full: I've visited El Sur a few times due to a friend who lives in the same street and it is just a really great value place with fantastic food. I have tried the salmon salad, moussaka, tortilla espanola (incredible), the chicken curry and most of the home made deserts - all absolutely delicious, clearly home made and fresh and a really great price. We've been there as a party of 10 before and they cleared seats and got a table together for us really quickly. Super service and I would highly recommend!! I love that I live in Madrid so I get to come back here anytime I want!

review_full: After reading Trip Advisors reviews we wanted to experience it for ourselves.  When we found it we both looked at each other and thought is this the place as it looked small and not what we were expecting. But whatever you do don't judge a book by its cover!  Once your inside you get absorbed by the spanish atmosphere and greeted by helpful friendly faces. All though it was busy we only waited 20 mins to be seated but while you wait you can have drinks at the bar. It has many locals in the restaurant and as we all no that's a good sign, Alex greeted us and from then onwards in my opinion is the most happiest, helpful, warmest waiter we have ever come across. He was exceptional and even though the place was full the bloke never even had a drip of sweat on him. He's as cool as a cucumber and worth his weight in gold. The food was amazing! Atmosphere was perfect, and we are so glad we never walked away.  A definite while your visiting Madrid. Thanks Alex

We were able to get a table within 10 minutes. Upon entering we were immediately greeted by the excellent staff! Our waiter was Alex and he was awesome. Honestly the best customer service I dealt with in my 5 day stay in Madrid. He explained the menu and made some recommendations of what to order. We had the grilled squid, smoked salmon salad and the salmon tempura. All excellent choices and reasonably priced. On our second visit we had the moussaka (a must try), rope veija (excellent), grilled squid and the croquets. The food was simply delicious. This place is a must visit while in Madrid! A little tricky to find but once you do you won't be disappointed. Thank you Alex! Our Jersey Boy in Madrid!

title_review: Great service and delicious food and sangrías.

review_full: We just had tapas at Más al Sur which was only a 5 minute walk from the original El Sur with no wait at all on a Sunday evening. We greeted our server in our limited Spanish, and he was very happy to converse with us in both English and Spanish. I think he really appreciated our attempts instead of just automatically speaking English.  The food was delicious as expected. Unfortunately they ran out of the salmon brochetas (which he told us happens all the time since they're so popular). Instead, we tried the gambones in garlic and the ropa vieja. Both were delicious and filling for the two of us. We also ordered a sangria and it was sweet and so delicious.  Our server, who like I said was super friendly and great, even gave us a free gigantic slice of cheesecake and it was absolute heaven. Didn't get a chance to take pics of everything since we consumed it so quickly, but did manage some pics of the cheesecake and sangría!

Honestly, the Sangria wasn't your standard out of a bottle like most Madrid bars, properly home made. We had a mixture of different Tapas dishes which were great, the Garlic Prawns especially. Make sure you visit this place, if we had given ourselves more time the evening we visited we could have sat here for hours with dish after dish. The staff were really great and friendly and even brought us a free drink as we left. Definitely visit here!

review_preview: We had a truly outstanding meal (in the restaurant downstairs).  They specialize in Jamon Iberico, and you should always try to eat the house specialty.  I cannot more highly recommend the "Presa."  It is a particular cut of meat that you'll find in certain restaurants....
review_full: We had a truly outstanding meal (in the restaurant downstairs).  They specialize in Jamon Iberico, and you should always try to eat the house specialty. I cannot more highly recommend the "Presa." It is a particular cut of meat that you'll find in certain restaurants. It's actually hard to believe that it is pork because it tastes like a very fine cut of beef (it's very marble-ized). As they grill it, you'll enjoy the extra tastiness of the cooking method. I can't say enough about how exquisite this dish is. We also enjoyed the foie gras with apples tapa. Nice combo. Unfortunately we'd had a massive lunch earlier the day we ate here, so we didn't try too many dishes, but what we had was all terrific. The service was also very good. After a snafu with the credit card, the waiter was gracious and patient (American guests - if you have a credit card like Capital One or AmEx which already does not charge a forex fee, make sure that they select "Euros" for your charge, otherwise you'll get stuck paying in dollars and they'll take the 5% forex fee onto your bill. This happens everywhere in Spain).

The gambas was incredible: I had 8 and they were in butter and garlic. Just delicious! Noodle wok was very good according to my wife. The salmon itself was good but it was strangely put together. So I just ate the salmon by itself (very good) and the green and red peppers by themselves and left the rest (cheese) there. Not much of an issue since I was already full from my gambas. Service was very good. We went early (for Madrid) at 7PM and it was still warm in the restaurant. When we left at 8:30PM it was much better. Overall a great experience to repeat. NB: we also had complimentary Baileys after dinner. Thanks!

review_preview: This place gets 100% across the board! The food, drinks, service, and vibes were all great! I came here with a large group (17 people) and they were very accommodating and set up the back room for us. While we were waiting we had drinks...
review_full: This place gets 100% across the board! The food, drinks, service, and vibes were all great! I came here with a large group (17 people) and they were very accommodating and set up the back room for us. While we were waiting we had drinks at the bar. They served the most delicious and beautiful sangria- it was full of different fruits (blackberries, pineapple, even kumquats!) and cinnamon sticks. Other people in my group got pina colada's which were also very tasty. Once we sat down, I ordered the prawn risotto and it was the best risotto that I've ever had! Very flavorful. Following dinner, we were treated to free dessert (some of the best cheesecake I've ever had) and free tequila shots (and I'm not talking about that bottom shelf stuff...). Our waiter was awesome and he brought out the entire kitchen staff to meet us. William, Andres, Gustavo, Yosmil, and Yoel were the best! I highly recommend this place. Tasty and fun experience

title_review: Casual. Delicious. Great Prices. Great Service.
review_preview: We absolutely loved our dinner at Taberna Mas Al Sur. It was our 11th day in Spain and we were tired of fancy, long drawn-out dinners. We picked here because it looked so relaxed, and it was. Our waiter, Gustavo, was soooo friendly and helpful....
review_full: We absolutely loved our dinner at Taberna Mas Al Sur. It was our 11th day in Spain and we were tired of fancy, long drawn-out dinners. We picked here because it looked so relaxed, and it was. Our waiter, Gustavo, was soooo friendly and helpful. He spoke English very well which made it smooth to order. The food came out timely, the bread was hot and delicious, the wine was local from Madrid and also very good. The only thing that made it less than perfect was the temperature. The day we went it felt like 95° and humid and they had the windows open and no AC. We arrived on the early side (8:30pm, compared to normal dinner time in Spain is 10pm) and noticed when we were close to the end of our meal that they had closed the windows and turned the air on (probably 10pm by this time.) All in all, excellent time. Loved the casual atmosphere &a friendly staff!  PS- We ordered the eggplant, hummus and cheese plate to start. The eggplant was to die for and came with a delicious berry compote. The hummus was super fresh and delicious. For main courses we ordered 1) mushroom risotto which was creamy and the best ever, 2) Cuban shredded flank steak which was delicious and served with chips (had more of an appetizer feel, as it was excellent for sharing), 3) Tuna Tar Tar which was very fresh but also a VERY large portion!, 4) salmon tempura which came with a balsamic honey sauce for dipping and that too was excellent, it was a little dry but I think they asked for it well done, 5) beef tenderloin which was cooked perfectly and served with scalloped potatoes that were very yummy.  Overall, I don't think you can go wrong here! Thank you Taberna Mas Al Sur for such a great experience in Madrid!! ❤️

title_review: Wonderful local place, ten minutes walk from the Prado
review_preview: So glad we decided to have lunch here on our museum day. Friendly English-speaking service, a nice mix of meat and fish dishes on the menu, and very creative attractively presented vegetable appetizers--the eggplant strips with aioli were standouts. Lots of locals at lunchtime so...
review_full: So glad we decided to have lunch here on our museum day. Friendly English-speaking service, a nice mix of meat and fish dishes on the menu, and very creative attractively presented vegetable appetizers--the eggplant strips with aioli were standouts. Lots of locals at lunchtime so it felt you're enjoying an authentic Madrid neighborhood vibe. Convenient to the Reina Sophia and Thyssen museums this is a perfect place for a great and modestly priced lunch. Their menu al dia was under 10 euros (though we didn't try it) for the truly budget-sensitive.

title_review: Meson Restaurante La Mi Venta, Plaza Marina Espanola, 7
review_preview: What a great evening we enjoyed in this fine establishment with great atmosphere and excellent service.Started with some drinks and nibbles in the upstairs bar area and a nice chat to the friendly owner Miguel.Then downstairs to the restaurant, where we had some...
review_full: What a great evening we enjoyed in this fine establishment with great atmosphere and excellent service. Started with some drinks and nibbles in the upstairs bar area and a nice chat to the friendly owner Miguel. Then downstairs to the restaurant, where we had some fresh cut bread with Ora Bailen olive oil, which apparently according to the very helpful Roberto, is the third best olive oil in the world. We had the very tasty hand cooked croquettes in picquant sauce which we shared., then for mains the wonderful hake supreme and the lamb chops with delicious potatoes, followed by a shared super lemon pie. With a great Rosado wine and a complimentary after dinner drink the meal came top 80 euros. Would certainly recommend and also you may need to book. Regards Gary Saunders

review_preview: We had a chance to visit David Munoz’s flagship restaurant in Madrid December 2019. The extravagant 40 years old chef develops 35-40 new dishes every year. His very unique cooking style with his extraordinary creativity results a perfect dining experience. He is bravely mixing Mediterranean,...
review_full: We had a chance to visit David Munoz’s flagship restaurant in Madrid December 2019.  The extravagant 40 years old chef develops 35-40 new dishes every year. His very unique cooking style with his extraordinary creativity results a perfect dining experience. He is bravely mixing Mediterranean, Asian and South American ingredients into art on the plate.  The dining room is a reflection of his extravagant style. Fancy decor with pink colour dominations, lot of curtains and theatrical elements like flying pigs all over. After the welcome drinks ( Grosset Grand Rose champagne with pink label) the meal started with canopes.  The cantonese chicken, the sheep's milk and maturated salmon croquette and the taco was a very impressive warming up, all were delicious with plenty of flavour. This was followed by some Indian dishes. A very deep flavour vindaloo curry was balanced with greek yoghurt, Dal Makhani & Frog leg prepared like buttered chicken masala, with papadum of lentils. Pan puri filled with New Delhi salmorejo and Joselito's coppa. Very special steamed, light and fluffy naan with truffle and Mumbai flower with pink pepper. The spices were beautifully balanced in all Indian dishes. Than we went to China. Roman style kokotxa was served together with Necora chilli crab and it was followed by one of the most successful dish of the meal, Xialongbao Xo Iberian soup dumpling with aged beef rib & bone marrow. All the elements were precisely flavoured and cooked.  And many, more and more beautiful dishes. Red mullet and smoked eel, The sea urchin we had to eat from our hand. That was followed by and another great dish, suckling pig skin with squids, matured tomatoes, Habanero puree. Idiazabal cheese, frozen green lemon and coriander root. The suckling pig skin was crispy and light, the light sweetness of the matured tomato was in perfect balance with the savoury of the cheese, the sourness of green lemon with coriander and the creamy Habanero pure. This was a terrific dish. Red mullet with Moroccan lemon, smoked chorizo juice and Olluco puree. A lovely dish with rich flavour was carefully balanced. Kagoshima wagyu fillet steak. A high quality, A5 grade , perfectly marbled, very high quality Kobe beef cooked to perfection. His 25 courses menu was a fantastic gastronomic journey around the world. With this wonderful diner we had a wonderful wine, one of my favourite Spanish white wines, a bottle of As Sortes from Rafael palacios’s winery. The presentation was extraordinary, the service was top level, smooth and friendly all the way through the 3,5 hours dining time. I am sure this was not our last visit to this fabulous place.

review_preview: I had read a lot about Sabe a Gloria on TripAdvisor before coming to Madrid and decided to add it to my list of restaurants to visit. It was worth it. We had lunch on a Saturday and the restaurant was booked up. Gloria was...
review_full: I had read a lot about Sabe a Gloria on TripAdvisor before coming to Madrid and decided to add it to my list of restaurants to visit. It was worth it. We had lunch on a Saturday and the restaurant was booked up. Gloria was so friendly, suggesting food for us to try. It was all wonderful. Her take on Patatas Brava is creative and yummy. The bacaloa was rich and creamy. We were too full for dessert, but what we saw at the other tables made us wish we had saved room. The price was very reasonable for the amount of food we ate.  I do suggest a reservation, especially on the weekend. We were fortunate to get a table without one because they were booked up for lunch.  Make sure you visit if you are in the musuem district. It is an easy walk from Atocha, Retiro, or the three big museums.

review_preview: We first saw Chef Muñoz during the Masterchef Italia competition (aired in 2019), where contestants had to work at his restaurant in Madrid, DiverXO. We came from Milano to dine at DiverXO in January 2020.A culinary experience out of this world.Prepare yourselves, go...
review_full: We first saw Chef Muñoz during the Masterchef Italia competition (aired in 2019), where contestants had to work at his restaurant in Madrid, DiverXO. We came from Milano to dine at DiverXO in January 2020. A culinary experience out of this world. Prepare yourselves, go to DiverXO with an open mind and you will for sure appreciate the Chef’s tasting menu. The different courses have the taste of European, Peruvian, Japanese, Indian, Korean, etc… A tour all around the world, just by sitting at the table in this extraordinary restaurant. Upon reservation, we asked for an Italian-speaking waitress/waiter, in order to better understand the explanation for each dish. We were assigned an Italian waitress who guided us through this experience and was very helpful, nice and professional during our 18 courses tasting menu. How to explain the experience at DiverXO? One of a kind. Everything was perfect, form the visit to the wine cellar, to the room kept at 16°C dedicated to the handling of raw ingredients and desserts, to the actual kitchen, with an astonishing number of professionals of the Chef’s team. Like art in a museum, whoever can understand this kind of culinary philosophy will surely remain full of marvel and the dishes are surely incredible, almost moving. All the senses are satisfied during this experience. Thanks again to Chef David Muñoz for taking the time to leave his place in the kitchen to take a picture with us. Just one thing to underline: the wine list is surely well equipped, pages and pages of different wines form all over the world, however we found just one red wine and just one white wine from Italy. That’s a bit thin! Overall, a culinary experience that is worth the travel, we cannot find the right word to describe it: my daughter suggested an Italian word, which doesn’t really have a proper translation in English: commuovente.

review_preview: Wow - I must say that I was very impressed by this restaurant/bar.I had a long wait for my train, and I was very glad I made the extra effort to leave the station for the delicious food they served me. Now to the...
review_full: Wow - I must say that I was very impressed by this restaurant/bar. I had a long wait for my train, and I was very glad I made the extra effort to leave the station for the delicious food they served me. Now to the details: The service was quick and very kind. The first order was ready in 7min, and tasted mind blowing. That was the Pintxo de Bacalao. The second came a couple of minutes later, which was the Pintxo de Calamares. Those did not taste as delicious, but the first course set a pretty high standard. The presentation of the food was beautiful (with little dried flowers acting as a garnish and adding a pop of colour). For those two courses, and a tea, the bill came to €14.80. Given the location, service, and quality of the food I thought this was very reasonable, and affordable.  To conclude, the next time I pass through Madrid I will make the effort of eating here again.  P.s. In retrospect I would have rather sat downstairs, where they have low tables, whereas on the ground floor it has much more of a bar feel. I did not notice these existed until too late.

title_review: Great ambience, very good food, very good service
review_preview: My husband and I ate at this restaurant in October, 2018.  We particularly liked the ambience with brick lined caves for dining rooms.  We shared chuletillas lechal (baby lamb chops) which were delicious, and then we shared the presa ibérico, a cut of meat from...
review_full: My husband and I ate at this restaurant in October, 2018. We particularly liked the ambience with brick lined caves for dining rooms. We shared chuletillas lechal (baby lamb chops) which were delicious, and then we shared the presa ibérico, a cut of meat from the black pig which was delicious and certainly tastes more like beef (it is a red meat) than pork. They have a nice wine list, and we had a very good Ribera del Duero wine. The service was very good as well as friendly. When I am back in Madrid I will eat here again.

title_review: Very Impressed with the Petit Menu (Lunch)
review_preview: Was lucky to secure a table for lunch even though I enquired the day before - very responsive team via email. Although I was a solo traveller, I never felt unwelcomed and service was great.Had the Petit Menu for lunch at 69 EUR. Loved...
review_full: Was lucky to secure a table for lunch even though I enquired the day before - very responsive team via email. Although I was a solo traveller, I never felt unwelcomed and service was great. Had the Petit Menu for lunch at 69 EUR. Loved every single dish and especially the small bites / snacks which were exquisite (I could only get through half of the main course - three roasted meats cannelloni because I was so full by then). The venus margarita cocktail was so interesting - will not spoil it but the experience was great. Lovely meal. Chef Ramon came out to greet guests as well. Also loved the fact that the staff were wearing sneakers (with suits). Have been to michelin starred restaurants in Japan, Singapore, Paris, London, and would say that Ramon Freixa is well deserving of its two michelin stars. Highly recommended for lunch.

Indeed, in Madrid, my meal at Terraza Casino/Paco Roncero was significantly better than DiverXO.  Several of the courses were pretty but were average in taste. In particular the indian inspired early courses while OK were not better than that from an average indian restaurant. Service was also spotty. Many times we needed to try to get a waiters attention to have water or wine refilled. The bill at DiverXO was more than the other 4 restaurants and came no where near the experience. In fact the bill at DiverXO was almost twice that of Terraza Casino because the food and wine were higher priced. The place has a hip feel and is a cool atmosphere but I wouldn't go again. I don't understand the 3 michelin stars.

title_review: After visiting 100's of top restaurants there is bound to be one bad one.
review_preview: My wife and I have traveled the world for food, it has became a passion. In these travels we have ate at top 50 restaurants on 6 continents and in all of those travels the lack of care by DiverXO is without question the worst...
review_full: My wife and I have traveled the world for food, it has became a passion. In these travels we have ate at top 50 restaurants on 6 continents and in all of those travels the lack of care by DiverXO is without question the worst in the world. When we visit restaurants we often find that the food is 1/2 of the experience and the care by their staff is the other 1/2. I feel very confident in saying the service at DiverXO has to be the absolute worst in the world. I don't know if it is because they have had such demand that they no longer care, or if they are just resting on the food and not caring about the customer. We booked a trip to the Madrid and San Sebastian area and secured reservations at 10 different Michelin Stared restaurants for my wife and two of our friends. Three weeks before the trip our friend had to have surgery and was no longer able to attend. We immediately reached out to all 10 restaurants and 9 of the 10 showed amazing customer service. the one exception is DiverXO. They stated we could either cancel or pay for the two extra meals. when I requested to speak with a manager they stated the same thing and were very unhelpful. at one point even saying "you should have planned better". How do you plan for an unexpected surgery? This shows an amazing lack of empathy and care about the customer.  Even with me writing this review I am positive they do not care, because they are still sold out. However, if you have a choice of places to visit, in an area with such great food, choose somewhere else that cares about their guests.

review_full: We were exploring the area and stumbled upon this quaint restaurant playing Spanish guitar music. The menu posted outside sounded intriguing so we decided to give it a shot. We couldn’t have been happier! Gloria immediately gave us a friendly greeting and seated us. We ordered the sangria de cava which I highly recommend! We started with the blue cheese croquettes which were fantastic and then Gloria recommended we try the pollo croquettes as well. Holy moly those were my favorite!!! Then we decided to share the duck and mushroom paella. It is literally OUT OF THIS WORLD! Since coming to Spain I’ve eaten several different versions of paella and this is the absolute best! We were both full after the paella but once again Gloria recommended a few desserts to try. Well...we are on vacation and walking a lot, right?!? Lol We got the warm chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream. Yum-O! They even gave us small glasses of sweet wine to go with our dessert, on the house! I will 100% be back on our next trip to Spain. Environment, service, and most importantly food was amazing!

title_review: The secret only locals know about
review_preview: Thanks to my girlfriend living in Valencia, I have the opportunity to visit Spain on a regular basis and  tasting the Spanish culture one bite at a time. Some time ago she took me to this restaurant Sabe a Gloria, and we both really enjoyed...
review_full: Thanks to my girlfriend living in Valencia, I have the opportunity to visit Spain on a regular basis and tasting the Spanish culture one bite at a time. Some time ago she took me to this restaurant Sabe a Gloria, and we both really enjoyed it. Really tasty food, good prices (menu of the day costed around 11€ a person including one [soft]drink 300cl bottle and dessert) and friendly personnel. Because of this we went back -today- and ordered the 'menu of the day'.  This restaurant is really hidden and without having the address or someone from Valencia taking you here, you will probably never find it (which is a shame). So if you're planning on visiting Bioparc (one of the most impressive Zoo's I've ever visited) or the Parque de Cabecera (free natural park) do yourself a favor and visit this typical Valencian taberna\restaurant and enjoy one of their fine meals.

review_preview: We booked into Diverxo almost 9 months ago so this has been a long time in coming and we had high expectations. We were not disappointed. There are 2 menu options,  one more 'adventurous' than the other. The restaurant being the purpose of our visit...
review_full: We booked into Diverxo almost 9 months ago so this has been a long time in coming and we had high expectations. We were not disappointed. There are 2 menu options, one more 'adventurous' than the other. The restaurant being the purpose of our visit to Madrid we went for the adventurous option. 19 canvas (courses) officially but with a few of the canvas having several dishes this ended up around the 25 mark and took around 4 and a half hours.  In the thousand and one travels around David's Oniric Works the stand out dishes were the Mexican elements, the monkfish, the Chinese section and all the desserts. The eels weren't to everyone in the party's taste and the prawn bolognese was a challenge after squeezing out the brains onto the dish as a sauce but the flavours were intense and it was a great experience.  No wine flight is available which we actually enjoyed as the focus was solely on the food then and the only disappointing thing was the lack of 'take away' goodies which other 3 stars seem to do. A funky soundtrack of 80s music restyled by The Lost Fingers and a tour of the kitchen before sitting down were nice touches and the restaurant and tablewear as a whole is well done and as weird as you'd expect if you see the promo video on the restaurants website. Price wise this came in at significantly less than the Fat Duck or other 3 stars we've been to which was a nice surprise and represented great value for money I thought.

title_review: Hospitality at its Finest.. for the Love of Paella!
review_preview: Today we spotted this charming restaurant and knew that we were destined to eat dinner @ Sabe a Gloria. We arrived at 5:00 only to learn from Maria Jose that the restaurant opens @ 8:00. Gloria told us that she wanted us to experience the...
review_full: Today we spotted this charming restaurant and knew that we were destined to eat dinner @ Sabe a Gloria. We arrived at 5:00 only to learn from Maria Jose that the restaurant opens @ 8:00. Gloria told us that she wanted us to experience the best paella in the city and that she and Julian would be willing to open their kitchen to us. Of course, we were overwhelmed by their kindness. They brought us a most delicious bowl of salmorejo cordobes, Paella Valenciana .. a original family recipe and cecina de Leon con oregano y aceite de Olivia. Not only the meal but the hospitality that they showed us was a memory to last a lifetime. Thank you Maria Jose, Gloria and Julian. Madrid is blessed to have you in their city.

title_review: Excellent; and I don’t give that rating easily.
review_preview: This seems to be a family run restaurant. Once we sat down, and the place was fairly empty, the couple who ran the place continued to welcome locals with hugs and kisses who arrived for dinner. To me a sure sign this place in a...
review_full: This seems to be a family run restaurant. Once we sat down, and the place was fairly empty, the couple who ran the place continued to welcome locals with hugs and kisses who arrived for dinner. To me a sure sign this place in a tourist locale still has a true local following. The service was homespun for sure but the food was fantastic without trying to be something it was not. Hours were not spent on plating here but what you received were true Spanish dishes with love and care put into each one. I had the vegetarian croquettes with apricot which were astounding in flavor and texture. Followed by barbecue pork ribs which were divine. Not buried in sauce but roasted in a way to allow the pork flavor to come through as it should. These were served with potato with specs of truffle and they were the perfect accompaniment. I would recommend this place highly. Well done!

title_review: Delicious Spanish food, kicked up a notch
review_preview: Although I was very familiar with this restaurant before it moved to Madrid, I was still knocked off my feet by my first visit to their "new" location. First of all, it's within very easy walking distance from many frequently visited sites in Madrid, but...
review_full: Although I was very familiar with this restaurant before it moved to Madrid, I was still knocked off my feet by my first visit to their "new" location.  First of all, it's within very easy walking distance from many frequently visited sites in Madrid, but its location on the Calle Huertas makes it more quiet and cozy. The locale is attractive and inviting, and everything is pristinely clean: restrooms, dining area, wine "cellar,", and (most importantly) the kitchen. The most meaningful aspect of a restaurant, though, is its food, and here is where Sabe a Gloria really stands out. The selection consists mainly of familiar and comforting traditional Spanish foods, all given an exquisite twist. For instance, you may think you like patatas bravas, but unless you've tried Gloria's individual fried fingerling potatoes adorned with piped bravas sauce and ajoaceite, you haven't had the best. All five of us at the table all agreed that, although everything else was excellent, we would all travel to Madrid simply for those patatas bravas alone! One companion ordered the entrecot (ribeye steak), which thrilled all the meat eaters at the table. Another fish lover was impressed with one dish (the name escapes me) broiled in a clay container, of cod and bechamel, which one spreads over bread. The timbal of goat cheese with caramelized slow-roasted vegetables on top was one of my favorites. Of all the many things I have tasted from Gloria's kitchen, I can affirmatively state that every single dish has been of the utmost quality and served with exquisite presentation. Mediocrity of any kind is just not found at Sabe a Gloria. You can, of course, order from a list, but I recommend you go with the menú del día or even just let your server and Gloria pick for you. Also, unless you spot a wine on the list that you absolutely MUST have, allow Julián to make a selection for you. I promise you'll be happy with his selection. Whether you're in Madrid for a weekend or two weeks, you'll want to put this place on your itinerary, and after you've tried it once, you'll want to repeat your visit!

review_preview: My girlfriend and I have eaten in quite a few multi Michelin star restaurants across the world and it takes an exceptional restaurant for us to go...OMG. Well Diverxo, did it. Finally we encounter a restaurant that provides us with a combination of cuisines (Spanish,...
review_full: My girlfriend and I have eaten in quite a few multi Michelin star restaurants across the world and it takes an exceptional restaurant for us to go...OMG. Well Diverxo, did it.  Finally we encounter a restaurant that provides us with a combination of cuisines (Spanish, Japanese, Chinese and Peruvian) and cooking styles that push the boundaries of flavours.  The restaurant was recommended to us by Nuno Mendes, the head chef of Viajante restaurant in London. We decided on the 12 course tasting menu and from the first dish the sparks started flying. The first dish consisted of duck tongue, avocado and cod. Second, frog legs, coconut foam, taro and mountain Japanese caviar. Third tuna belly. Fourth, prawn & shitake mushroom with chicken consommé. Fifth, Japanese bun with mushroom and cecina. Sixth Schrimp carpaccio. Seventh, suckling pig a la Being duck. Seventh part 2, 'Burger'. Eight, monk fish with French purple potato sheets. Tenth, 'stewed' ox & rice paper. Intermezzo of raspberry gum. Eleventh, violet panacotta. And last, white chocolate with celery foam, frozen olives and cucumber jus.  Often you eat a dish in a Michelin restaurant that is good, but not jaw dropping...not the case with Diverxo. Every dish is imaginative, inspired, daring, measured and extremely well executed.  Unfortunately, Diverxo doesn't allow pictures to be taken of the food, but the dining experience more than makes up for it. I would go as far as to say that together with Martin Berasategui and Akelare in San Sebastian, I'd consider Diverxo to be amoung the best in Spain. They deserve a third Michelin star in my book. I can't wait to visit Madrid again and sample some more of their dishes.

title_review: So much more than a meal: an experience, an experiment and a surprise
review_preview: Diverxo is tucked into a non-descript store front in a residential area of Madrid, a humble cover for the remarkable experience that awaits inside. An open mind about food is required, since what is brought to the table pushes the boundaries in many ways. A...
review_full: Diverxo is tucked into a non-descript store front in a residential area of Madrid, a humble cover for the remarkable experience that awaits inside. An open mind about food is required, since what is brought to the table pushes the boundaries in many ways. A friend and I got reservations for lunch for one day to the next, and we got one call for confirmation. The dining room was decorated in a black, grey and silver palette, which I found a touch industrial, with Philippe Stark influences. Service was impeccable from the start, with the staff anticipating our needs, responding promptly without being genuflect and explaining the complex dishes. We had the basic 7 course meal of 2 appetizers, 3 dishes and 2 desserts. Since everything is a small portion, this was equivalent to a regular lunch of first, second and dessert. Now, the similarity with anything regular ends there. The quality of ingredients, presentation and flavors were fantastic. Each dish was a beautiful arrangement, an abstract installation of edibles a surprise for the eyes. The flavors matched the looks, original without being bizarre, with very interesting fusion of mediterranean and asian flavors and techniques. I could go on and on, but suffices to say that what we got at Diverxo is exactly what I expect from a high-end restaurant. If you come to Madrid, don't miss it.

review_full: Warning-no English spoken. Feckless maitre ‘d must have been expecting a crowd based on his facial expressions and actions but the crowd hadn’t shown up by 8PM and he turned away potential customers. It took them 20 minutes to take our order; they kept saying “uno momento” but then focused on other tables (and they weren't that busy). We finally placed our order but another 20 minutes passed before we got their attention to bring us the drinks we had ordered. Then they poured our wine glasses less full than they did for the locals at the table next to us. The Paella Valenciana had more beans than meat and overcooked rice. My Dorado was the whole fish that you had to take care eating because of the bones, but the accompanying orange salad was tasty. The horrible service continued when I had to request 3 different staff members for the check; another 20 minutes. Dinner in Spain can be slow, but service in this place was just plain rude. I should have been suspicious of all the single TA reviews rating this place a 5 using similar words. Poor Staff no entiende ingles, but can respond to English reviews in Espanol. Be forewarned! This is the worst restaurant that I have ever visited in 8 years while writing for TripAdvisor. They deserve a zero.

It was fantastic - simply melting on your tongue! The dessert (crema pasiega) and the coffe were great as well. We had also some shrimps as a free appetiser and were treated generously with a typical north Spanish aperitif- crema de orujo. It was super tasty. Highly recommend this place - the food and wine are great, the atmosphere is fantastic (there was typical Spanish music playing the whole time), and the hosts more than perfect. Greatly appreciated!

review_preview: My father and I went to Madrid for a long weekend (Thurs - Mon) to watch a Real game. Whilst there we ate out every day for lunch and dinner. We had many very nice meals but the food at Sabe a Gloria was the...
review_full: My father and I went to Madrid for a long weekend (Thurs - Mon) to watch a Real game. Whilst there we ate out every day for lunch and dinner. We had many very nice meals but the food at Sabe a Gloria was the best we had and as a result we ended up eating their twice during our stay. The waiter was very attentive without being over bearing and the service received was first class. Our first meal was the mid-week menu del dia (menu of the day) which was both delicious and very reasonably priced - from memory it was about 10-15Euro pp for a 3 course meal and a cerveza. We went back on our last day and went with the chef's house recommendations for a three course meal which was fantastic traditional Spanish food. We ended up conversing with the chef (through our waiter who acted as a translator) who was a lovely lady. The restaurant itself has been fitted out in an authentic style and had a nice ambience. In summary we cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough.

I had been attempting to get a table at Diverxo for the past three years. Not been able to determine with enough anticipation the time of my next visit to Madrid prevented me from booking sufficiently in advance. Fortunately, however, Diverxo's reservation system provides the option of waitlising. And I just happened ro chose that for a lunch spot during the second shift. Given our high expectations, and the wonderful ambiance (the staff certainly makes you feel you are living your own fantasy) we opted for the 18 course menu. I can't describe the experience. There are no words that can prepare you for what you are going to experience. So, being a regular contributor to TripAdvisor, this would be the first time I decide not to list or describe the dishes - or should I say gifts - we were presented with. I can only tell you, if you are lucky enough to get a table at Diverxo do not miss the opportunity. You will live an experience you will treasure for life.

My wife asked for the chicken thighs that were meant to come with potatoes with a citric twist. When it arrived it was two chicken drum sticks in a congealed gravy jelly with instant smash. The microwave could be heard in the background.  I ordered the spiritual cod which consisted of a Luke warm rubber like, cheese, onion with a few pieces of cod.  When the bill arrived we were charged for the water despite not receiving it. The staff did apologise for this mistake but overall considering the price we were extremely disappointed with the food. It certainly wasn’t fresh ingredients and the fact the microwave could be heard in the background was very off putting.

We chatted with the waiter, even though we had little Spanish and he had little English, and enjoyed the wine. The next day we returned for dinner and met the owner, who recommended what we should eat. We took her recommendation and had a wonderful rice dish. The wine the sommelier recommended (again we chatted in English/Spanish) suggested was excellent. We had a luscious meal and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves - best meal of the whole trip. Staff and owners were friendly and helpful. Service was top notch. Two of us go to Madrid at least once a year and we have added this to our very short list of "go to" places.

review_preview: I read about the Diverxo restaurant whilst searching on how to celebrate a special occasion in Madrid. I was immediately intrigued by all the the reviews I read online. Unfortunately I found that the restaurant was fully booked and there was quite a waiting line....
review_full: I read about the Diverxo restaurant whilst searching on how to celebrate a special occasion in Madrid. I was immediately intrigued by all the the reviews I read online.  Unfortunately I found that the restaurant was fully booked and there was quite a waiting line. After a cancellation I was lucky enough to still be allowed in. We started our evening with a tour of the restaurant. It is amazing to see how this restaurant functions. As we were the first ones in, all tables were still surrounded by drapes and it looked very magical. The pigs and other decoration everywhere just add to this feeling.  We were seated and immediately served an aperitif and handed the menu (see picture) the waiter advised us, as it was our first time at Diverxo, to opt for the smaller one. The sommelier also suggested a white wine or champagne to pair with the menu and we opted for the latter.  The first 3 dishes, the Mexican canvas, were delicious and with our table still surrounded by drapes with eyes coming from Alice in Wonderland had a very cozy feeling.  The music playing in the background (classic song covers in a laid back jazzy mix) added to the whole Diverxo experience. Wonderful, but different. Upon receiving the second dish the drapes were removed and revealed the rest of the restaurant. It was amazing to see the whole restaurant running as a machine. All guests were seemingly having an amazing time. The waiters explain the dishes, tell you what is different about the dish in Diverxo and how to eat it. (With your hands, with a tail-like spoon, with chopsticks, ...). My girlfriend and myself couldn’t stop laughing. In total we enjoyed 15 dishes whereof the last 5 were dessert (the big menu is 23 dishes). We were more than full and I am glad we took the waiter her advise on choosing the smaller menu. There was not a single dish that we didn’t like. Personally I loved all of them. At the end of the evening the bill came down to 500€ total (120 of which we already paid as a booking confirmation). The menu itself was 195€ per person. The bottle of champagne was 90€ and the aperitifs and coffees were 20€ total. Obviously this is quite expensive but given the experience in the restaurant I found it well worth the price. Whilst it will not be in the near future I do see myself coming back for the larger menu. I’d like to thank ALL the people (and there were many) whom served us, laughed together with us and made our visit an experience not to be forgotten. And of course special thanks to the chef and his kitchen team for his great ideas and wonderful dishes.

title_review: Exceptional good food, but explanation was not always accurate
review_preview: This restaurant is very good, with exceptional food. We liked the fusion style. All 24 dishes were great in taste. The portions were perfect. Not too much, not too small. The vibe in the restaurant is good, not too formal. The price of the menu...
review_full: This restaurant is very good, with exceptional food. We liked the fusion style. All 24 dishes were great in taste. The portions were perfect. Not too much, not too small. The vibe in the restaurant is good, not too formal. The price of the menu is 225 euros. That is a normal price for a restaurant from this category.  Three remarks: 1) as only one of us was Spanish, we asked for explanations in English. Unfortunately, the English of some waiters was very hard to understand. And also the explanations were not always accurate. We heard in other tables (in Spanish) more detailed explanations. One time this really went wrong. In one of the last dishes was a crab shell, covered with mousse. The waiter told me to eat it with the hand, but did not tell me that I should not eat the outside. As it was completely covered, I did not realize the crab shell was not eatable. I found out too late. And instead of apologizing, the waiters were just laughing.  2) We ordered wine by the glass. And what happened was the same as we experienced in other Michelin star restaurants: the sommelier was not longer interested in us. That is a shame. We had four glasses (of 12 euro each) of wine, but we dit not get any explanation about the wine. They did not even show us the etiquette of the wine. Also, the glasses were extremely small. Just two fingers of wine. Disappointing 3) There were mistakes in the bill. They added two bottles of wine that we did not order. Luckily, I was sharp enough to realize this. But I can imagine that guests that are a little tipsy don`t check well their bill and pay too much. This should not happen in a restaurant with 3 stars. Overall, - except for the small remarks -, we were very satisfied. Great food, great taste and spectacular dishes.

title_review: Dining heaven - Spain at its very best
review_preview: This restaurant was the last of many up market dining venues chosen by my wife and I during a three week stay in northern Spain.For me it was the best even in comparison with other truly outstanding options in Spain such as Lasarte in...
review_full: This restaurant was the last of many up market dining venues chosen by my wife and I during a three week stay in northern Spain. For me it was the best even in comparison with other truly outstanding options in Spain such as Lasarte in Barcelona, Marques De Risqual in La Rioja, Arzak in San Sebastian or La Terrazza in Madrid. The attributes of what sets this restaurant apart from its peers are too lengthy to record but include a superb chic setting, service that is prompt and friendly but not overly formal or in your face, crockery and cutlery that add to the theatre and of course the inspired creative food. The other bonuses are the lunch set menu at 70 euros a steel and for us and indeed as we saw every diner meeting the chef Ramon. It was just one of the meals/experiences that I wont forget for all the right reasons!

Glad I came and would recommend you try it. Probably a once in a lifetime visit.

review_preview: What can I say without giving too much away? I'm conscious that I'd want anyone who visits Diver❌⭕️ to experience this full gastronomic explosion of the senses in its entirety. I'm simply in awe and blown away by chef Dabiz Muñoz. This man is a...
review_full: What can I say without giving too much away? I'm conscious that I'd want anyone who visits Diver❌⭕️ to experience this full gastronomic explosion of the senses in its entirety.  I'm simply in awe and blown away by chef Dabiz Muñoz. This man is a creative conscious genius, hence why he has received his Michelin 3 star accolade for what can only be described as a 'Masterpiece De Art Cuisine'. Dabiz and his extraordinary team of service professionals not only take you on a cuisine journey, they encourage you take flight and join Dabiz on his journey as he sees it.  It's time to let go of your inhibitions and get playful. This is where Alice in Wonderland meets Stanley Kubrick. If you haven't already guessed, I'm obsessed by this incredible journey of which I am so grateful to have experienced.  Dabiz, you and your team are truly visionaries, you push boundaries and take your guests somewhere they have never been before.  Note: Come hungry, with an open mind, engage with the service team on the floor and strap yourself in as it's going to be a fabulous ride.

title_review: Lots of food, and a lots of laughs
review_preview: I’m wondering how to describe a restaurant experience like DiverXO without spoiling the fun. David takes you on a journey through the unknown with a lot of surprises on its way. We had a wonderful time, and the experience were as fun as we had...
review_full: I’m wondering how to describe a restaurant experience like DiverXO without spoiling the fun. David takes you on a journey through the unknown with a lot of surprises on its way. We had a wonderful time, and the experience were as fun as we had expected. A lots of food, and a lots of laughs. We really really enjoyed our self. A great experience The only complaint we have is that they did not have any wine pairing, or something equal. It is not about having the perfect wine or cocktail per dish with a match made in heaven. In my opinion there should be away to enjoy good wine selected for the dinner. The bottles we had were however amazing.

review_preview: It's an overwhelming and incredible experience. So good and full of surprises. I've been lucky to visit several Michelin star restaurants and this is probably in my top three, which is a super top consideration. The great thing about Diverxo is the ability to surprise:...
review_full: It's an overwhelming and incredible experience. So good and full of surprises. I've been lucky to visit several Michelin star restaurants and this is probably in my top three, which is a super top consideration. The great thing about Diverxo is the ability to surprise: from the taste exploration to the storytelling, passing through decoration and the waiters dresscode. I loved their freshness and coolness and the way they approached customers, that was a little different to what you expect in this kind of restaurants (friendly, close and with a touch of craziness). Food is a constant exploration and it travels continuously to Asia and to exotic gastronomies. We were super well advised to stay with the short menu (thanks god we trusted the waitress instead of deciding what we normally do at this "once in a lifetime" places). Loved absolutely the experience and I really encourage you to go.

review_full: Had been wanting to go this restaurant for years. Probably the highest in my achievable reservations Bucketlist lol. I'm a fan of tasting menus witb over 20 courses; so this place gets extra points for that. The meal was super good, outstanding in fact. However, it didn't necessarily blew my mind (which was what I was expecting). I concluded was that this was because the flavor profile isn't one I like a lot. Super inventive dishes though I think sometimes vulgar. But it's worth mentioning that each and every dish I think were the most harmonious I've ever tried. Meaning the dish as a whole worked perfectly and to my liking rather than trying each ingredient individually. That's why even though it might've not been my flavor profile they managed to convince me. Conclusion had it been flavors more fitting my palate this would've been a perfect 10 of a meal and quite possibly one of my best meals ever.

review_preview: Yes the chef is creative...but in my opinion his food is going nowhere. There is no harmony between dishes..the menu makes no sense and the food taste was awful. - some ingredients tasted awful (fish and meat )- the mix of flavors was most...
review_full: Yes the chef is creative...but in my opinion his food is going nowhere. There is no harmony between dishes..the menu makes no sense and the food taste was awful.  - some ingredients tasted awful (fish and meat ) - the mix of flavors was most of the time wrong and not matching -the fish was undercooked and smelly.. The waiters were arrogant and not classy... Their english wasn't so good so i had a plate described as : " this is the head of the duck...and this one is like the inside of the duck (showing me his belly ) n u eat it with this croissant.."   I personally can't eat the inside of a duck..nor his head, nor a dumpling of rabbits brain..nor a chips made of chicken skin...followed by barely cooked fish..n eat the head of shrimps..with sauces that dont even match.. I am used to eat pigeons so i decided to try one of their dish with tomatoes and pigeon... Oh my god it just tasted like old blood..i felt sick.. The desserts are ok...but after being presented a dozen of sickening plate i just wanted to run away..which we did. I have to admit that i am a very sensitive client and although i enjoy "la haute gastronomie" this restaurant was my worst experience even in terms of food. It doesnt deserve the michelin stars. I felt sick during the whole evening.. Basically this restaurant has:  -no service -no harmony in the menu -mismatched decoration -no harmony in the plate Just a waste of time and money

title_review: Good, but certainly not the best in Madrid
review_preview: We went for the 11 course tasting menu (which is quite lot of food). Most dishes are served in pairs of three (for instance three ways of cooking tomatoes).Overall the food was good and accomplished, but there were some culinary mistakes. My girlfriend found...
review_full: We went for the 11 course tasting menu (which is quite lot of food). Most dishes are served in pairs of three (for instance three ways of cooking tomatoes). Overall the food was good and accomplished, but there were some culinary mistakes. My girlfriend found some of the the dishes to be too salty (for instance the deep fried bread), some of the combinations were questionable (tuna and apple soup) and the decoration might not be to everyone's taste.  I liked that Ramon Freixa took the orders himself and the service was very good. But as noted before, there is areas for improvement.  Overall Ramon Freixa is worth a visit, but would recommend other restaurants before going there (such as Diverxo).

review_preview: Truly is an amazing experiment of flavours, textures, presentations and experiences. They warn you that you should go for the short menu because is already a lot of food... and it is!  A phenomenal trip to the Mediterranean, India, China, Mexico... and even to fast...
review_full: Truly is an amazing experiment of flavours, textures, presentations and experiences.  They warn you that you should go for the short menu because is already a lot of food... and it is!  A phenomenal trip to the Mediterranean, India, China, Mexico... and even to fast food!  The staff choreography was amazing, so many different waiters showing very well coordinated. Some a bit stiff and like they tell the same joke every time.  As Mexicans we were very please to see several dishes with Mexican ingredients, and from one staff member told us Daviz have never been there... he should because it will give him a slight better perspective of how to make better use of some Mexican ingredients, like achiote or substitute some leaves with hoja santa or epazote.  But all in all... one of the best experiences we've had and our first 3 star restaurant ever. We have to try the others!

review_preview: Being the only 3 star Michelin restaurant in Madrid, it's one of the must places to dine. It does take several months to obtain a reservation but the food is simply devine. Dabiz's creativity and interpretation on ultra modern cuisine truly radiates in his creations....
review_full: Being the only 3 star Michelin restaurant in Madrid, it's one of the must places to dine. It does take several months to obtain a reservation but the food is simply devine. Dabiz's creativity and interpretation on ultra modern cuisine truly radiates in his creations. It blows all other Madrid Michelin restaurant out of the water.  Why the average rating? We expected a very edgy atmosphere and unique dining experience - which indeed it was. What we did not expect, was such poor service.  Impressed they offered a choice of languages to have the service in, we opted for English. While my partner is Spanish, I didn't want him to translate throughout the entire meal. We were both there to enjoy. However, during the first and second dish the server didn't speak English. After reminding the host we would like the service in English and after the 4th dish, they were finally able to assign a server to communicate to us. Why offer English if you don't have someone readily available? As each of the dishes were set up and presented, each was a unique setting, we felt like the staff was hurried as they literally threw down the cutlery and place settings at us. As the uniforms were reminiscent of an Oompa Loompa could the scurried service possibly part of the theatrics? At a price tag of over 550 euros for two people, the service should be aligned with the food quality.  Despite the service, I would go back after some time has lapsed and hopefully the staff have been refreshed or have refined their manners.

review_preview: Once you enter the Diverxo then you enter an another world... Full of colors, flavors, feelings and emotions... There is no other experience like this... This place is not just a wonderful "maison de bouche" but a real earthquake. We were told and have read...
review_full: Once you enter the Diverxo then you enter an another world... Full of colors, flavors, feelings and emotions... There is no other experience like this... This place is not just a wonderful "maison de bouche" but a real earthquake. We were told and have read so many things about the Chef Dabiz Munoz that we wonder if he was real... And the fact is that He is real and much more crazy and innovative than expected. This moment was not only a meal but an extraordinary experience. Some could say that it is too much but everything is perfectly organized, done, inspired and imagined. Of course, you definitely need to love pork and you do have to know perfectly the spanish wines if you want to appreciate everything but it is a true journey. Don't forget to be very hungry also and to have time... As this was our very first time there, we were proposed the "little menu El Xow" about 2 and 1/2 hours but there is also "the full El Xef" menu which is 3 and 1/2 hours... It is so difficult to explain what we felt but the best way I could describe is that I only understood completely the presenting video from the website after that experience and the video reflect exactly the sensations... Add to that a tour of the kitchen and a meeting with the Chef Dabiz then you realize how unbelievable was that moment... Thank very much again for everything and for being so creative and friendly, thank you Mister Munoz

After all, how can you describe unique flavour combinations with words created by the intellect. Flavours have their own emotional language. David Munoz speaks that language fluently and to perfection! This is an unforgettable experience that will lay embedded in my flavour memory for a very long time. Thanks for letting me in on the waiting list and for letting me tast some new creations. I dined alone but actually it is better to enjoy the flavours to the full!

title_review: Quality service and amazing dining experience.
review_preview: Just one quick warning... due to the nature of the experience dining alone could be a little  awkward for the first 15 minutes of the tasting... The entry way to the restaurant is awesome.  I had a blast just taking photos before being seated.I...
review_full: Just one quick warning... due to the nature of the experience dining alone could be a little awkward for the first 15 minutes of the tasting...  The entry way to the restaurant is awesome. I had a blast just taking photos before being seated. I did the El Xef tasting menu and was not disappointed by a single dish. Every course was excellent and more than once, I was tempted to just start licking the plate. The two things I enjoyed most were the duck heart(uhmazing) and the cotton ice cream. The staff were all friendly and knowledgeable. They answered every question I had. I loved their attire and that everyone was wearing running shoes. The next time I am in Madrid I will definitely dine here again. If you are in Madrid and love excellent dining experiences this place is a must!

title_review: Delicious consistently innovative cuisine in an intimate surround
review_preview: We ate here last night, and it was a night to remember. We had the twenty course tasting menu, but this does not include a number of amuse bouches.  We all enjoyed it all immensely.  No course was disappointing.  And a number of them were...
review_full: We ate here last night, and it was a night to remember. We had the twenty course tasting menu, but this does not include a number of amuse bouches. We all enjoyed it all immensely. No course was disappointing. And a number of them were out of this world: the baby prawns cones, the codfish omelette, the Mexico homage, and the King Prawn. Service is outstanding. Because there are basically seven tables, you are treated extremely well. We also appreciated the very reasonable wine list, and the fact that the restaurant did not charge for bottled water. Total bill for four came to about 800 Euros, but it was absolutely memorable. If we return to Madrid, we will be back. There is a sister restaurant in Barcelona.

review_preview: “Cuisine is art.  And as such it has to communicate, provoke and excite, good or bad.It cannot leave you indifferent.” - quote on the first page of the menu....I am always excited to try excellent cuisine, and have good service.  I went for...
review_full: “Cuisine is art. And as such it has to communicate, provoke and excite, good or bad. It cannot leave you indifferent.” - quote on the first page of the menu.... I am always excited to try excellent cuisine, and have good service. I went for a business dinner, arranged by a colleague. Not knowing much about the restaurant I tried to go with an open mind to be surprised. The decor of the place if fantastic, especially the exterior garden looks like it would be wonderful to enjoy a drink before dinner. The service was in general polite with a few off moments, however timings were off and a sense of actually caring about serving and your customer - and not just going through the motions was certainly perceived... (If you want excellent service in Madrid try Santceloni) Everything was quite correct as we came in, we were taken to the table offered water and a drink. It took a while for the menu to come, and when it did we literally had 1 minute before we were interrupted by the first appetizer. As soon as we completed the appetizer the Chef came to ask if we had found something we liked on the menu, to which we said we had not had time to look at the menu, he then aggressively suggested a tasting menu on us, which we accepted. I must say usually I do go for the tasting menus at fine dining restaurants however the way it came about was not comfortable, and almost no hint of what would be served was given. Of course right after came the sommelier to ask us if we wanted some wine, to which again we told him we had no idea what we would be getting for food, to which he told us well a good wine will do very well... again we were left a bit dumbfounded. Thankfully my colleague knows wines quite well, once we decided to go for a white we consulted with the sommelier and he advised our choice would go very well with the dinner. The wine was excellent it was Emilio Rojo Ribeiro 2016. We did mention to him that as he mentioned our last dish was meat, we would likely love a glass of red with the meat dish, this of course was never offered. The food was good in terms of taste/quality etc - but I can easily think of 5 restaurants in Madrid that are much better. The food lacked (with the exception of 3 small dishes) provocation - most plates left me indifferent (go back to the first quote).  Example they had a dish with Carabineros, which were in terms of quality and tenderness amazing, but no taste. The seasonal tomato dish, a small sort of bag of small shrimp and the mexican dessert were the only dishes to really astonish (for the amount of food we ate, this is not enough). to accompany our dessert we had a wonderful sweet merlot wine recommended by the sommelier. Unfortunately other than the previously stated mexican dessert on the sampling plate, the rest of the dessert left us with a disappointing sensation. Overall, the restaurant probably deserves a 4 rating but I gave it a 3 as the bar should be higher for this sort of establishment.

review_full: Two big things. One is that I have an allergy to scallops and I told them that when I booked and when I arrived. But I ended up getting very sick during the launch having to go to the bathroom twice. So either scallops were mixed into a dish or one of the other shellfish they served me was stored commingled with scallops. Or something else very strange happened... I don’t know.  And the other is that I thought a glass of cava that was included in the weekday lunch menu. They ended up charging me extra for it, but at that point I was too sick to fight it and simply wanted to pay and leave.  Finally, a minor point. A dined solo and it felt strange. I’ve done this in many places but here I felt as if I was constantly being watched.  That being said, the presentation and service were great. The flavors of the dishes were hit and miss for me.  But I simply can’t and won’t return.

title_review: First half sublime, second half inedible
review_preview: We had the deluxe tasting menu with wine pairing, and cannot recommend either. The appetizers and fish courses were spectacular: imaginative, delicious, served at the proper temperature. But after these (and after the chef went home) the meat courses were inedible: lukewarm, oversalted, all cooked...
review_full: We had the deluxe tasting menu with wine pairing, and cannot recommend either. The appetizers and fish courses were spectacular: imaginative, delicious, served at the proper temperature. But after these (and after the chef went home) the meat courses were inedible: lukewarm, oversalted, all cooked the same way (mushy sous vide). Ugh. Then the desserts were truly awful (they need a pastry chef). As for the wine pairing, it was a poor deal--three glasses of the house cava, followed by a succession of bargain wines, only one or two of which seemed interesting. The sommelier was comical as he gushed over an Austrian pinot gris that retails for $11 at Costco. Poor price to value ratio. For $600 you can do much, much better in Madrid--go to Diverxo or enjoy 3 meals at lesser-known restaurants where the chef is still working hard. The worst part was that when we sent back dish after dish, no one cared in the least.

title_review: Wonderful food, beautiful atmosphere, and a kind chef
review_preview: My husband and I love eating at the world's top restaurants, but this time we wanted to bring our five-year-old daughter with us, to start including her in our passion. I called ahead to see if a young child would be welcomed, and was told...
review_full: My husband and I love eating at the world's top restaurants, but this time we wanted to bring our five-year-old daughter with us, to start including her in our passion. I called ahead to see if a young child would be welcomed, and was told that as long a she was well behaved, that she would be, and a special veal cannelloni dish would be prepared for her.  As expected, the food and presentation were wonderful; we enjoyed each immensely. Other reviews will go into the menu details, but I want to highlight how much the kindness of Ramon and his team impacted us and our daughter.  From the start, Ramon was amazing. He came over to us to welcome us to his restaurant (as he did to all of his guests), but extended a special welcome, complete with a chef's hat, to our daughter. She reciprocated by drawing a picture of him in his restaurant, and towards the end of the meal, he took her on a tour of the kitchen and she left with a giant (!) bag of Valrhona chocolates (that he uses in his desserts), and which she thoroughly enjoyed for the rest of the trip. My sincerest thanks to Ramon and his team for making her first Michelin experience so magical. We will be back!

Nice touch though. Service was impeccable and I can't wait to go again next time in Madrid!

review_preview: A succession of delicious and contrasting dishes presented during our 3 hour indulgence, with inspired wine pairings (peas and champagne, aged amontillado with smoky king prawns and a rare 45 year old fortified wine from Alicante with the dessert - just some examples) All the...
review_full: A succession of delicious and contrasting dishes presented during our 3 hour indulgence, with inspired wine pairings (peas and champagne, aged amontillado with smoky king prawns and a rare 45 year old fortified wine from Alicante with the dessert - just some examples) All the superlatives mentioned by other reviewers are true, and Mr Freixa personally took our orders. Though eye-wateringly expensive it's actually good value as there was so much work put into each and every offering. We arrived on bicycles which was a little unsettling for the door staff at the hotel but they got used to it and found a home for them ! A couple of tiny little grumbles - first; the staff rattled off the dishes' explanations a bit fast and seemed unwilling to elaborate - we had two serious enquiring questions for information on some of the ingredients but no responses received, and the team seemed a bit "too" choreographed and need to relax a bit. Secondly - and come on - why two changes of napery ? - that's just needless and doesn't impress. The final touch of a chocolate muffin to take away was lovely though.

title_review: Should you?  If want a modernist cuisine adventure, and can afford it, you won't be disappointed.
review_preview: Spaniards, especially Madrians, eat late, so it wasn't much of a surprise that arriving promptly for our 9pm reservation made us one of the first parties to be seated.  it didn't take long to fill up dining room either, with only 26 seats, and a...
review_full: Spaniards, especially Madrians, eat late, so it wasn't much of a surprise that arriving promptly for our 9pm reservation made us one of the first parties to be seated. it didn't take long to fill up dining room either, with only 26 seats, and a requirement to be there punctually if you want the tasting menu--and why would you go to effort and expense of getting a reservation if you weren't going to have a grand experience? To be fair however, there is a 25 course experience, but most diners, us included, opted for the 20 "moments". We added the wine pairing too. The service was attentive but not hovering or fawning. The staff were happy to engage with us informally but clearly they are focused on precise service of the moments, landing the plates synchronously with their explanations. The tastes, textures, and marvelous "chemistry" was amazing throughout. (Menu and almost all dishes captures in photos.) Even with the slow pace, I began to realize partway through the meal that I simply couldn't finish every dish or every class of wine; there was just too much. I have no regrets about this at all; in fact, I think it's fantastic to be able to eat and taste as much as you like compares to many high end restaurants whose portions are more art than food. No shortage of art here, and you'll be satisfied too. We concluded the meal (around 1am!) with a brief peek into the spotless and surprisingly small kitchen. if you are willing to spend the time and money, you will enjoy it immensely.

title_review: Simple pit, a stunning experience from start to finish
review_preview: This restaurant is located in the posh area of Madrid and in a beautiful hotel Relais. From the moment you arrive you are treated very special and the chef Ramon, greets you with a suggestion of his ala carte or allow him to feed you...
review_full: This restaurant is located in the posh area of Madrid and in a beautiful hotel Relais.  From the moment you arrive you are treated very special and the chef Ramon, greets you with a suggestion of his ala carte or allow him to feed you how many courses your feel you can achieve. The course sizes are very light, extremely tasty and we opted for 7 which was just enough. The wine list is extensive and can be a little overwhelming but the sommelier will help you happily with a selection to suit you and your budget. There is no pressure here to impress, just enjoy. The food from the very first course to the last is worth every inch of the two Michelin stars earned and very quickly they may find their third. review_preview: We planned to go to the restaurant almost a month before arriving in Madrid, therefor, we emailed TWO WEEKS before arriving, explaining that one of us does not eat any kind of meat, willing to know if would be possible to eat there, and the...
review_full: We planned to go to the restaurant almost a month before arriving in Madrid, therefor, we emailed TWO WEEKS before arriving, explaining that one of us does not eat any kind of meat, willing to know if would be possible to eat there, and the return of the restaurant was: it would not be a problem at all, since the menu could be adapted with other dishes available. Upon arriving at the restaurant, we sat down and an extremely rude man began to speak in an altered tone of voice with us when we pointed out that one of the people does not eat meat, as comunicated by e-mail. He said, ''WE DO NOT HAVE ANOTHER MENU! IF YOU WANT TO EAT, THAT IS WHAT WE HAVE'', and continue to speak with contempt. Well, this gentleman passed the image we had the whole night of the restaurant, of an unprepared team that does not know how to adapt to the client. So on, the employees came multiple times to discribe the meatless dishes and were like ''for you, the dish is x because you.... you know...'' looking at me with a horrible face. To complete the experience, there was a HAIR inside one of the dishes of the meatless menu. WHAT?? A HAIR? DISGUSTING. We were completly disappointed and surprised, and when we tried to communicate to the worker Maria what happened, she said it was because "we are from South America and in Spain people are colder" and because ''the chef does works if meat so they were not able to prepare any meatless menu''. Unbelievable. For us, this kind of response shows lack of preparation, since we warned TWO WEEKS BEFORE, and the restaurant had the courage to serve a cheese platter as a tasting menu, I DO EAT FISH AND SEA FOOD, and you do serve a CHEESE PLATTER? REALLY? What a shame! We've been to an enormous amount Michelin-starred restaurants in the US, Switzerland, France, England, Portugal, Brazil, Denmark, Sweden, Italy, Germany, Netherlands, Austria, Belgium and we were NEVER EVER been so mistreated like this. We lived for 2 years in Switzerland, so this excuse ''the Spanish are cold '', to justify a very rude employee, does not work for us. And the other excuse ''we don't do meatless menus'' it's even worst, because WE SEND AN E-MAIL ASKING IF IT WOULD BE POSSIBLE, AND THE ANSWER WAS YES. So incredibly disappointing.  I've A SORT OF SICKNESS and I'm UNABLE TO EAT MEAT, it is not a wish out of my mind. The food was just OK, nothing else, and we were not able to enjoy it because the service was disgraceful. I hope at some point you all learn how to treat clients.

title_review: Best Meal in Madrid, Charming Ambiance + Great Service!
review_preview: After spending three weeks in Spain, I had grown quite tired of Spanish cuisine. Oliveto was a great and welcome find. The place is charming and the staff welcoming. Every dish we ordered was amazing. For a starter, you MUST order the "Il Castillo," which...
review_full: After spending three weeks in Spain, I had grown quite tired of Spanish cuisine. Oliveto was a great and welcome find. The place is charming and the staff welcoming. Every dish we ordered was amazing.  For a starter, you MUST order the "Il Castillo," which is grilled then rolled eggplant filled with smoked cheese in a creamy pink sauce.  Two standout FRESH pasta dishes, the first being my favorite: pasta "purses" filled with ricotta, truffle and pear in a gorgonzola sauce, and the pasta filled with porchini mushrooms in a porchini Parmesan cheese sauce.  The chocolate hazelnut torta and mojito pancetta desserts were also amazing.  The food was so great, we returned twice.

review_full: I think it's safe to say that Italian in Madrid was a bust. Okay, I know .. who goes to Spain to eat Italian food. That would be us .. Italian in every country, and in our case because we currently live in Spain .. Italian in every major city. (worked out FABULOUSLY for us in Seville!) We gave it three shots -- this was number two -- and it's just no bueno. Service was excellent .. and yes, they DID send us away with the limoncello! We also ordered every dessert on the menu and enjoyed those. However: We started off with the eggplant parmesan .. little misunderstanding for us there; we all hate eggplant, but didn't realize that was what we were ordering LOL it was fine though, totally our bust, and we still tried it. Three of us did pizzas and one of us did pasta. Pizzas had GREAT potential -- good cheese, excellent crust ...... no.salt.in.the.sauce! Bland, bland, bland. Same with the pasta .. had enormous potential, but absolutely no follow though. We don't get it.
