review_preview: My husband and I came here on a recent short trip to Madrid and our night at Ramon Freixa was a very memorable experience for us.  The food was very good, but what really set the restaurant apart for us was the service and the...
review_full: My husband and I came here on a recent short trip to Madrid and our night at Ramon Freixa was a very memorable experience for us. The food was very good, but what really set the restaurant apart for us was the service and the presentation of the food.  Watching the servers carry out each course was like watching a well orchestrated play. These guys were completely in sync and really knew what they were doing! There must have been at least 4-5 people who were serving us throughout the night and they were all very sweet and very charming.  I think we must have sampled 25-30 separate items throughout our meal, not including the wine paring. The presentation of each was so creative and imaginative. The most memorable for me were the tomato salad served over liquid ice, the Tarantino inspired brain dessert, and the manchego cheese mimetic stone. Everything was tasty. My taste buds were most impressed with the red mullet served over what I would describe as a seaweed bisque.  The restaurant is part of a Hotel Unico (which looked amazing from the lobby) and is in a posh part of Madrid. The meal is pretty pricey but oh so worth it. I would highly recommend if you're looking for an amazing dining experience.

title_review: We really wanted it to be better, but...
review_preview: I’m an international airline pilot and as such, have the great privilege of being able to dine in restaurants all over Europe and South America. My wife often joins me on my “working vacations” and this time, we had three nights in Madrid. One of...
review_full: I’m an international airline pilot and as such, have the great privilege of being able to dine in restaurants all over Europe and South America. My wife often joins me on my “working vacations” and this time, we had three nights in Madrid. One of my First Officers told me that a “self-proclaimed Foodie” flight attendant highly recommended La Mi Venta, just an 8 minute walk from our hotel. So when I saw the great reviews on TA, I knew we would eat there at least one night, probably our first. The restaurant doesn’t open until 8PM and we arrived around 8:10. We were given a very good cup of beef broth when we arrived, without a reservation and it was perfect after pausing in the park on our way to play with the walked local dogs. It was pretty cold and the broth was a soothing, warming beginning. We were seated downstairs and the setting was beautiful. My only recommendation would be to dim the lighting a bit. Our waiter was friendly, gracious and spoke impeccable English. We asked his recommendations and for a starter, he recommended the Acorn-Fed 100% Iberico Ham. He said the restaurant was famous for that. Done. For a main, he recommended any of the MEATS. My wife was in more of a fish mood, so she ordered the Cod Loin Coated in Tempura. After a late lunch, I wasn’t terribly hungry so I ordered the Beef Truffled Hamburger, Medium Rare. We also ordered a bottle wine, a Protos, Ribera del Duero Riserva 2012. WOW! If you enjoy full-bodied reds, with a bit of tannin, reasonably priced, you’ll LOVE that wine.  Before the starter came, our waiter poured a bit of EVOO to enjoy with our bread. It was medium-green in color and as an admitted olive oil snob, I have to say it was one of the best EVOO’s we have had at a restaurant in Europe. (Check out “freshpressedoliveoil.com”) The favorite part of our meal was the Olive Oil and the wine. But from there, things were not as pleasant. My wife’s Cod, in my opinion was very good. Three pieces, about an inch and a half square, deep fried (?) and placed atop a spoonful of mashed potatoes. The fish was hot, flaky and good. But definitely not a gourmet dish. Reminded me of a really good chain seafood restaurant. Good, but not OMG!. My Beef Truffled Hamburger was interesting but not in a good way. It was tender, juicy yet overcooked for my taste so don’t take the temperature as too much of a guide.  The taste/mouthfeel was...different. I LOVE a good burger and this wasn’t one I would order aging. (BTW...when in Madrid, look for Goiko Burger. A “fast” food chain and DELICIOUS!. Perfect place for a take-away. So here’s our bottom line on La Mi Venta... I MAY go back to try a meat entree. When I walked past the grill on the main floor, the steaks cooking there looked and smelled DELICIOUS. The Iberico Ham Starter was really good. I’m not an expert on that, so I would have to defer to someone who is. The beef broth upon arrival was above and beyond. The atmosphere was beautiful. Just dim the lights a bit. And we probably ordered the wrong mains. It appears that their best mains if Meat. So will I return? Probably. If only for the Extra Virgin Olive Oil and Protos wine.

title_review: Unusual Ambiance,  Fantastic Service, Beautiful Presentation, Average Food!
review_preview: Constant Companion and I were really looking forward to eating at the Meson Restaurante La Mi Venta. We had read so many great things that we prioritized it as a "must visit". Following a visit to Monasterio de las Descalzus Reales we walked to La...
review_full: Constant Companion and I were really looking forward to eating at the Meson Restaurante La Mi Venta. We had read so many great things that we prioritized it as a "must visit". Following a visit to Monasterio de las Descalzus Reales we walked to La Mi Venta which is close by and also recommended by one of the staff at the Monasterio. We did not have a reservation but were immediately seated in the "Cave", a quaint adorable dining room in the basement. Two other couples and a large party of 13 were also eventually seated reaching the room's capacity. CC ordered 1 Emina Verdejo Rue(3,10) and I ordered 1 Aqua Vichy(3,60) and eventually2 Copa Casa Cerveza(7,0). We decided to split an order of Calamares a la Ro(13,30). The calamari was cooked just a bit too long but still very good-not the best and certainly not the worst. CC opted for the Bacalao Rebozado(19,50), a Cod Loin Coated in Tempura with minced Peppers and Sherry Vinegar. This dish was perfectly presented and cooked but over breaded. My selection was the Grilled Entrecot ordered medium rare(20,50). Again the rib steak was perfectly cooked as ordered and expertly presented. It was partly one of the best steaks I have ever had but also part of it too tough due to the sinew,which was a disappointment. Our waiter, Christian, was fabulous and assisted his colleague with the large party as necessary. He even brought us a complementary aperitif with the bill(69,00). Despite a few faults we would return, especially to try the Jamon, which is a specialty!! I am in between 3 and 4 stars on the Food but given the Presentation and Service I rate it a 4!

title_review: Very good lunch at La Mi Venta
review_preview: We had a very nice lunch at la Mi Venta during a recent visit to Madrid. Restaurant has two opening times each day, 1-4.30pm and 8-11.30pm, there is a small ground floor seating area as well as lower level seating. Outdoor seating was available on...
review_full: We had a very nice lunch at la Mi Venta during a recent visit to Madrid. Restaurant has two opening times each day, 1-4.30pm and 8-11.30pm, there is a small ground floor seating area as well as lower level seating. Outdoor seating was available on the day we visited as well.  Dining environment is nice, worth dressing up if you enjoy nice dining. However, casual attire seemed to be just fine during our lunch, which is convenient on hot summer days if you've been out sightseeing all morning. Restaurant is not far from Palacio Real, just across the street from Jardines de Sabatini.  During our lunch, we enjoyed a plate of the Iberian acorn fed ham, Chorizo from Hell and Manchego Goat Cheese, which was more then enough food for two diners. The ham was very, very good - salty but slightly sweet and the fat just melted in your mouth. The cheese complemented the ham quite well and the chorizo was succulent, not as hot as we expected but with produced lots of flavour.  Server helped us choose a local wine which we enjoyed. We shared and enjoyed a chocolate mouse with pistachio gelato dessert as well.  Overall, everything was very good at La Mi Venta, which proved to be one of the best meals we had in Madrid. This seems like a very good option for visitorsinteresting in having a nice dining experience during their time in the city.

The staff were wonderful and attentive, without being intrusive, with genuine enthusiasm for the food they were serving. We all opted for tapas dishes to share for starters and individual mains, which were absolutely delicious. There was something for everyone on the menu. My seafood-loving friends raved about their calamari while my lamb cutlets were an excellent match for the Duero wine they recommended. The restaurant itself is gorgeous, with bags of character, and perfect for couples, groups and families alike. We were made so welcome and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Madrid.

review_preview: I took my wife to Ramon Freixa for her birthday and the only word I can use is outstanding!Last year we went to a 3 Michelin starred French restaurant, but without doubt this experience was way better!The restaurant is small, intimate and beautifully...
review_full: I took my wife to Ramon Freixa for her birthday and the only word I can use is outstanding! Last year we went to a 3 Michelin starred French restaurant, but without doubt this experience was way better! The restaurant is small, intimate and beautifully decorated. One sits at small tables in the covered garden area with aperitifs and one's menu and Ramon himself comes out to each table and talks over what choices and preferences you'd like - a really nice touch! We selected the Territory tasting menu with complementary wines and were delighted we had! Every dish that was presented to us was beautifully presented and exquisitely cooked! There is a sense of fun in how several of the dishes were presented, which never detracted from the taste and flavour, but made one anticipate the next dish! I could not fault anything we ate, from starter selections to desserts. The complementary wines the sommelier selected were perfect for each dish - highly recommend doing this! The overall service was exemplary from start to finish - excellent! Ramon comes around a couple of times, during the evening, to ensure every table is happy with everything, and they even presented my wife with a quirky little cake to celebrate her birthday! An outstanding dining experience for sure!

We order the short menu, which I would, say it is enough quantity for a dinner. Ramon Freixa helps you to choose the right menu, which is great.  Choosing the wine is a harder task...Wines are really overpriced. Sommelier is only recommending wines over 100 euros, in a country were a good bottle of wine should be more than 20 or 30 euros.  A lot of small dishes are served, some better than others, but food presentation is fantastic. Mains are good but not spectacular.  Variety of bread is really great. Definitely a good experience, although we expected more from the dinner.

review_full: I have to make my compliments to all the staff of this restaurant. the location is really nice, elegant, but not too formal and the service has been almost perfect. The food has demonstrated not only the great creativity of the chef, but also a well balanced senso of the innovation starting from the tradition. We selected the Territory menu (real cost with taxes and service around 100 Euro + wine) composed by 2 or threee aperitives, 2 starters, one main course (quite big), pre-dessert, dessert and patisserie. The dessrt surprised me a little bit: it was really good, but quite simple (it was a choccolate patty cake. It was delicious, but I was waiting for something more... creative. In any case the dinner has been perfect and for me the price. Another mention must go to the fantastic bread. If you are in Madrid, you have to go. Maybe it is less creative than the Cub Allard, but the cusine is as much good as the famous Club Allard.

review_preview: We enjoyed the amazing "Gran FRX" tasting meal for lunch while in Madrid, having secured a table on short notice. From the minute we entered (quite under-dressed in the hiking clothes we had been wearing that day) we were treated like friends and felt welcome....
review_full: We enjoyed the amazing "Gran FRX" tasting meal for lunch while in Madrid, having secured a table on short notice. From the minute we entered (quite under-dressed in the hiking clothes we had been wearing that day) we were treated like friends and felt welcome. Note to future guests: I wouldn't recommend the hiking clothes, but if you have nothing else to wear you needn't worry one bit ;) Ramon Freixa personally came to welcome us and take our order... a gesture I really appreciated. And all of his staff, from the lady at the reception to the sommelier were very friendly and -more importantly- extremely competent in their jobs. This was one of the most impeccable services I have seen in all of my Michelin-inspired culinary experiences. The dishes were delicious, creative compositions with wonderful textures, and gorgeous presentation. The wine pairings for our menu were very good as well; their sommelier is extremely knowledgeable and willing to give as much information as needed. Another highlight was the bread, which Ramon "imports" from his father's restaurant in Barçelona. All in all a wonderful experience... this place definitely deserves its 2 Michelin stars in my opinion. The price for two tasting menus, wine flights, and water and cava to begin was very fair (EUR 500), and I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting Madrid. If I had to critique something, I would have to say that the interior was a bit too much for my taste, but that is a very personal thing. Also, be sure to go hungry if you are planning on the full tasting menu. We left so full we didn't eat for the rest of the day :)

title_review: You can not imagine what you will taste. Mmmmm..
review_preview: We came the restoran for St.Valentine's Day. The chef welcome us at the entrance. I was little bit hesitant when I heard the resturant is the part of the Hotel, But the ambiance, and the atmosphere is so well done that you never feel unconfortable....
review_full: We came the restoran for St.Valentine's Day. The chef welcome us at the entrance. I was little bit hesitant when I heard the resturant is the part of the Hotel, But the ambiance, and the atmosphere is so well done that you never feel unconfortable. There are few tables which is well enough for such an restaurant. Decoration is very modern and good. Wall has an panaromic view of Madrid that you feel at the top of high rise building looking towards the city. I don't like heavy meals with full of souce and cream. All Michelin star restaurans, that I tried, have such heavy dishes. We ordered tasting dishes. The waiter, full of kind and smiley behaviour, advised us the small set where we were all thanked him a lot in the end. Tasting dishes are very artisticly designed, full of color, shape and taste harmony.The tasting wines were so coherent with the dishes. Shape and content as well as all side dishes never gives you a clue about the taste of the dishes. For example when you swallow pebble (!), a volcano explode in your mouth. I really enjoyed to taste the creations of Mr.Ramon. The price are high, but I never even thought about that. I absolutely reccoment the restaurnt to my friends. Thanks a lot.

We were looked after Roberto who seemed to charm everybody with his calm manner and clear explanation of the menu. We started with a glass of house white, our starters consisted of beautiful baked mushrooms and a tapas sized piece of hake. Husband chose home-made burger and myself a colourful plate of grilled vegetables served with a delicious sauce. Around euro 45.

title_review: So good, we couldn't stop laughing...
review_preview: Picked this restaurant based on the stellar reviews. Requested a table in 'the cave'.  Fantastic ambiance, great gin drinks, good jamon, but what set this place apart for me was the main course.  I opted for the steak, which was over-the-top good.  My wife had...
review_full: Picked this restaurant based on the stellar reviews. Requested a table in 'the cave'. Fantastic ambiance, great gin drinks, good jamon, but what set this place apart for me was the main course. I opted for the steak, which was over-the-top good. My wife had the pork loin. Now mind you, I've had good pork loin in the past, but I was NOT prepared for the amazing flavor and texture of the meat that arrived at our table. This was BY FAR, the best meal I've EVER had in my 55 years. Roberto our waiter was attentive and polite. Highly recommended!!!

review_preview: We decided this was the place for us to celebrate our thirtieth. Small, off the main drag and intimate. We started with a pitcher of Sangria outside and some wonderful jamon while watching the sun go down. Moving inside to what can be described as...
review_full: We decided this was the place for us to celebrate our thirtieth. Small, off the main drag and intimate. We started with a pitcher of Sangria outside and some wonderful jamon while watching the sun go down. Moving inside to what can be described as a wine cellar we enjoyed a great meal. I had the goat and my wife a very large steak. Everything was cooked to perfection, the service was perfect. While dining we enjoyed a wonderful Spanish red which was a perfect match for the entrees. Come enjoy Spanish cuisine at its finest!
